result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on November 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order to Seal Victim Key
The original document was titled: Victim Witness Key
The original history event date is: 10-21-2022

[MK] cases #22CF254, #22CF306, #22CF472 called at 2:39pm 
Defendant Marquis Deshon Hamilton in court, in custody, with Attorney Michael Short.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Initial Appearance is held in #22CF472: 
--Attorney Short indicates that he will be counsel of record in the case.  
--Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by the Defense; ADA Shock agrees to the December 2nd scheduled date for the hearing. 
--The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to make any acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1 as referred to in the Criminal Complaint and the Victim Witness Key 
--not to possess any firearms 
recess 2:53pm 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on November 23rd at 10:00am-only counsel need to appear,  (2) Preliminary Hearing in Case #22CF472 and Status Conference on the other cases--all on December 2nd at 8:30am
Proposed Order to Seal Victim Key
